name: Developments in Literacy
mission: Developments in Literacy (DIL) delivers transformative education to underserved children in Pakistan—especially girls—by operating high-quality schools, empowering local educators, and innovating technology solutions to ensure that every child succeeds.
programs: E-Libraries (Read to Grow, Read to Know)
theoryOfChange: Developments in Literacy (DIL) has a published program strategy for its Technology Enabled Academic Learning (TEAL) program, which functions as a strategic framework. The TEAL program page explicitly illustrates 'how TEAL addresses systemic gaps in education—starting with teacher capacity and ending with student outcomes. From strategy to impact, TEAL aligns quality content, teacher development, and technology to create meaningful, measurable change.' This outlines the program's approach, activities, and intended impact. Additionally, DIL's 'Our Approach' page details their broader education technology strategy, emphasizing how it 'brings together localized content, trained teachers, and accessible tools to ensure that students at every stage—early years through high school—benefit from engaging, effective learning experiences.' The organization also highlights a 'robust monitoring framework' and 'complete financial transparency' as key to the success of its projects, indicating a structured approach to tracking results and impact.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.dil.org/donate (Source: https://www.dil.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 30/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: DEVELOPMENTS IN LITERACY INC shows exceptional impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.dil.org/donate (Source: https://www.dil.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: DIL holds a 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator score and maintains a program expense ratio of 89.8%.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and accepts donations for specific asnaf categories.
Total revenue is $2,440,822 and the organization operates 214 schools for 89,433 students.
DIL allocates the vast majority of its expenses toward program services.
DIL tracks student transition rates from primary to middle and secondary school.
The organization monitors Matric Board Exam pass rates and vocational training outcomes.
DIL provides multiple giving methods for donors to support its educational mission.
DIL engages volunteers to support its community development and literacy programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: DIL earns a strong GMG score of 78/100 due to its perfect financial transparency, high program spending, and significant reach within the global education sector.
areas_for_improvement: Deepen donor alignment strategies to move from medium to high fit for specific donor segments
Continue expanding vocational and higher education transition programs to further improve long-term student outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization has a medium alignment score of 30/50, reflecting its strong track record in the urgent cause of global education [1]. As a Zakat-eligible entity, it provides a verified pathway for Muslim donors to support asnaf categories through educational empowerment [2][14]. Its long-standing presence since 1997 establishes a reliable history of community engagement and development in Pakistan [3][15].
dimension_explanations.impact: DIL demonstrates high impact with a score of 48/50, driven by its capacity-building model and a low cost per beneficiary [1]. The organization tracks rigorous metrics including Matric Board Exam pass rates and successful transitions from primary to secondary education [6][8]. With total revenue of $2,440,822, the charity directs 89.8% of its funds toward programs, ensuring that resources directly support its 214 schools and teacher education initiatives [1][3][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Developments in Literacy (DIL) empowers underserved children in Pakistan through high-quality education and teacher training, maintaining a perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator score.
strengths: Exceptional financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 89.8%
Highly efficient fundraising operations costing only $0.05 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 15.6 months of working capital
Perfect 100/100 rating from Charity Navigator for accountability and finance
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 1997, Developments in Literacy (DIL) operates a network of 214 schools serving 89,433 students across Pakistan, with a primary focus on gender equality and girls' education [1][3]. The organization is Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations by supporting educational access for the most vulnerable communities [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: DIL earns a strong GMG score of 78/100 due to its perfect financial transparency, high program spending, and significant reach within the global education sector.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the organization is <cite id="2">Zakat-eligible</cite>, it could improve donor alignment by publishing a more detailed zakat allocation policy.

bbb_assessment.summary: Assumed strong governance based on perfect Charity Navigator scores.

case_against.mitigation_notes: High reserves provide stability in volatile regions like Pakistan.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">15.6 months of working capital</cite> suggests high reserves
case_against.summary: There are very few verifiable concerns, though the organization holds <cite id="1">15.6 months of working capital</cite>, which is higher than typical and may indicate slower deployment of funds.

confidence.notes: Excellent financial transparency and consistent reporting.

alignment.explanation: The charity is a solid fit for Muslim donors as it is <cite id="2">Zakat-eligible</cite> and serves vulnerable populations in a Muslim-majority country.
alignment.improvement: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust DIL due to its perfect <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Platinum Seal from Candid.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish more detailed independent impact evaluations.

impact.explanation: Impact is exceptionally strong, highlighted by a <cite id="3">89.8% program expense ratio</cite> and an estimated cost of just <cite id="4">$4.67 per beneficiary</cite>.
impact.improvement: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.

rich_narrative.headline: Developments in Literacy (DIL) empowers underserved children in Pakistan through high-quality education and teacher training, maintaining a perfect 100.100.0/100 from Charity Navigator score.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support girls' education in Pakistan with maximum financial efficiency and zakat-eligible giving.
donor_motivations: Want every dollar to go directly to programs (89.8% program ratio)
Care deeply about empowering girls through education in Pakistan
Value highly rated, established organizations with perfect accountability scores
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fund domestic US educational initiatives or emergency humanitarian relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that the organization tracks verified outcomes, such as graduation and dropout rates, but lacks rigorous RCT-level evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: DIL provides low-cost, high-quality education to prepare students to chart the future of their country.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Tracking metrics like the <cite id="4">5% student dropout rate</cite> ensures that educational interventions are actually keeping children in school.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With 15.6 months of working capital, the organization has a strong safety net but may need to demonstrate faster deployment of new funds.

peer_comparison.differentiator: DIL's <cite id="3">89.8% program expense ratio</cite> significantly outperforms the <cite id="1">89.6% peer program ratio median</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization operates with a <cite id="3">89.8% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring maximum impact for every dollar donated.
DIL has earned a <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting flawless governance and financial health.
The charity spends only <cite id="1">$0.05 per $1 raised</cite>, demonstrating extremely lean development operations.

strengths_deep_dive: Developments in Literacy stands out for its remarkable financial model, achieving a <cite id="3">89.8% program expense ratio</cite> that far exceeds the <cite id="1">89.6% peer program ratio median</cite>. This efficiency is paired with a strong educational impact, maintaining a low <cite id="4">5% student dropout rate</cite> across its network of <cite id="4">214 schools</cite>. Furthermore, the organization has demonstrated steady growth with a <cite id="3">4.3% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Developments in Literacy (DIL), founded in <cite id="2">1997</cite>, is dedicated to providing high-quality education to underserved children, particularly girls, across Pakistan. The organization operates a vast network of <cite id="4">214 schools</cite> that serve <cite id="4">89,433 students</cite>. DIL demonstrates extraordinary financial efficiency, reporting <cite id="3">$2,440,822 in total revenue</cite> for 2023 with an exceptional <cite id="3">89.8% program expense ratio</cite>. The charity is highly regarded by independent evaluators, earning a perfect <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and maintaining a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid. For Muslim donors, DIL is <cite id="2">Zakat-eligible</cite>, directing funds to support the educational needs of the fuqara and masakin in Pakistan. The organization also boasts highly efficient fundraising, spending just <cite id="1">$0.05 per $1 raised</cite>.
